examples: Harassment or bullying is unacceptable behavior in the workplace.
Her behavior toward her colleagues was unprofessional.
The parent modeled good behavior by always wearing a seatbelt in the car, even for short trips.
The CEO's focus on customer satisfaction was reflected in the employees' behavior, as like master, like man.
Here are 4 behaviors a narcissist displays that reveals their true colors.
words.defineEn: the way that someone acts, particularly in the presence of others
words.defineVi: cách mà ai đó hành động, đặc biệt là trong sự hiện diện của người khác

examples: She and her sister look very similar, but they have very different personalities.
With his charming smile and charismatic personality, Jonathan had a way of sweeping women off their feet without even trying.
The two politicians had vastly different ideologies and personalities, and it was clear that oil and water do not mix when it came to their ability to work together.
But as time went on, I realized that our personalities clashed in some important ways.
He turns heads when he walks into a room, with his charismatic personality and fashionable attire.
words.defineEn: all the qualities that shape a person's character and make them different from others
words.defineVi: tất cả những phẩm chất hình thành tính cách của một người và làm cho họ khác biệt với những người khác

examples: Its characters are painted in broad brushstrokes.
Most characters in his movies are somewhat larger than life.
He brings the character of MacDonald to life with power and precision.
A person's character can often be deduced from their actions.
The talented actor effortlessly portrayed a wide range of characters, from a hero to a villain.
words.defineEn: the set of mental qualities that make a certain person different from others
words.defineVi: tập hợp các phẩm chất tinh thần làm cho một người nhất định khác với những người khác

examples: The bill was four votes shy of a majority.
She was one week shy of her 13th birthday.
They scored just shy of 100 goals last year.
MacMillan has never fought shy of controversy.
The Democrats are three votes shy of a majority.
words.defineEn: nervous and uncomfortable around other people
words.defineVi: lo lắng và không thoải mái xung quanh người khác

examples: I've noticed that ever since he came into some money, Joe has become more talkative and confident.
So watch out for those talkative tummies.
He's not too talkative.
Flight of ideas, being more talkative.
Number three, you are more talkative than usual or feel internal pressure to keep talking.
words.defineEn: talking a great deal
words.defineVi: nói nhiều

examples: Her condition is very serious.
He avoided serious injury following a head-first fall on to the ice.
The thrill-seeker who skydived without proper safety precautions ended up with a serious injury.
Riding a bike without a helmet may seem like harmless fun, but it can have serious consequences.
Touch wood, I've been lucky enough to avoid any other serious injuries.
words.defineEn: thinking carefully about things, and not joking
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ cẩn thận về mọi thứ, và không đùa

examples: The play was too funny for words.
He always tells funny jokes that make everyone laugh.
I saw some really funny pictures of myself as a kid and I couldn't believe what a minger I was.
She imagined kids making funny faces after trying scorzonera for the first time.
We spent the evening watching funny movies and she felt much better.
words.defineEn: able to make people laugh
words.defineVi: có thể làm cho mọi người cười

examples: You raise some interesting points.
We had a very interesting discussion about climate change.
It's an interesting proposal.
All of them had an interesting story to tell.
The game's premise and mechanics are interesting, but there's just no meat on the bone when it comes to story and gameplay variety.
words.defineEn: catching and keeping our attention because of being unusual, exciting, etc.
words.defineVi: thu hút và giữ sự chú ý của chúng tôi vì khác thường, thú vị, v.v.

examples: The movie was as boring as they come.
It’s so boring, eating the same food day in, day out.
I have to do the same boring jobs day in day out.
The child nodded off to sleep during the boring lecture.
This course seemed right up my alley when I signed up for it, but it ended up being dreadfully boring.
words.defineEn: making us feel tired and unsatisfied because of not being interesting
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy mệt mỏi và không hài lòng vì không thú vị

examples: Holy moly, this is exciting news!
The company CEO let the employees in on the exciting news about the upcoming merger.
Hockey is an exciting sport played on ice or field, with sticks and a small puck or ball.
Take the initiative and fill your life with exciting experiences.
They claim drag racing is the most exciting motor sport.
words.defineEn: making us feel interested, happy, and energetic
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy thích thú, hạnh phúc và tràn đầy năng lượng

examples: The old lady's cake wasn't wonderful
Doesn’t Rosie look wonderful?
Squash adds a wonderful texture and sweetness to curries.
Since the news broke I've received thousands of wonderful letters.
To my eye, Jake, you're the most wonderful man on the planet.
words.defineEn: very great and pleasant
words.defineVi: rất tuyệt vời và dễ chịu

examples: The paneer curry smells amazing!
It’s amazing.
My mom is an amazing cook.
It is amazing really.
That's amazing Ralph.
words.defineEn: very good or impressive; excellent
words.defineVi: rất tốt hoặc ấn tượng; xuất sắc

examples: The California vineyards produce excellent wines.
Camembert is an excellent choice for a picnic.
She would have made an excellent teacher.
Liz Quinn was considered an excellent teacher.
Regular investment of small amounts of money is an excellent way of building a nest egg.
words.defineEn: extremely good in quality or other traits
words.defineVi: cực kỳ tốt về chất lượng hoặc các đặc điểm khác

examples: The match was awesome.
That part was awesome.
The captions were awesome.
Prokaryotes are awesome!
These people are awesome.
words.defineEn: extremely good and amazing
words.defineVi: cực kỳ tốt và tuyệt vời

examples: The companies are two of a kind.
Thank you, you're very kind.
My aunt is a really kind sister to my father.
Thank you for your kind words, they made my day.
The lost child was helped by a kind police officer to find their way home.
words.defineEn: friendly and nice to others; caring about other people's feelings
words.defineVi: thân thiện và dễ mến với người khác; quan tâm đến cảm xúc của người khác

examples: She really is weird, unsympathetic and is useless for the better part of the movie.
A: "Who's that weird guy standing in the corner?"
Audiograms are weird.
The end of the season gets weird.
This texture is weird.
words.defineEn: very strange, unusual, and not natural, in a way that is difficult to understand
words.defineVi: rất lạ, khác thường và không tự nhiên, theo cách khó hiểu

examples: Everything appeared normal at first.
I tried to lead as normal a life as possible.
She may seem normal at first, but you'll realize she has many screws loose once you hear her conspiracy theories.
As every normal human being knows, one shouldn't throw good money after bad.
When people are in their right minds, they make reasoned decisions and act in a normal, understandable way.
words.defineEn: (of a person) without physical or mental problems
words.defineVi: (của một người) không có vấn đề về thể chất hoặc tinh thần

examples: Rugby and art seem strange bedfellows.
The dishwasher is making a strange noise.
He holds strange views on education.
It felt strange to be back in my old school.
The society's preoccupation with safety and stranger danger is just unbelievable.
words.defineEn: having unusual, unexpected, or confusing qualities
words.defineVi: có phẩm chất bất thường, bất ngờ hoặc khó hiểu

examples: The garden looks nice.
The soft carpet feels nice under my feet.
The children were nice as pie.
This room would make a nice office.
The spicy sausage and mushroom fusilli had a nice kick of flavor.
words.defineEn: providing pleasure and enjoyment
words.defineVi: cung cấp niềm vui và hưởng thụ

examples: Your presentation sounded great, honestly.
The finance minister's fall from grace gave his enemies great satisfaction.
To show great courage.
The pope himself had taken great umbrage at the book.
The baby has brought them great joy.
words.defineEn: worthy of being approved or admired
words.defineVi: xứng đáng được chấp thuận hoặc ngưỡng mộ

examples: My job is the tough one.
The boss is very tough on anyone who steps out of line.
She is made of tougher stuff.
The team's defense is a tough nut to crack.
Long hours and tough working conditions are often par for the course in catering.
words.defineEn: strong and able to deal with problems
words.defineVi: mạnh mẽ và có thể đối phó với các vấn đề

examples: The milk skin gives a unique texture to the homemade pudding.
The briny taste of olives adds a unique twist to my homemade pizza.
The natural tanginess of tamarind adds a unique twist to sauces, marinades, and soups.
Cheshire cheese has a unique flavor profile.
The unique flavor of physalis pairs wonderfully with dark chocolate in desserts.
words.defineEn: being one of a kind, with no equal
words.defineVi: là một trong những loại, không có bình đẳng

examples: I couldn't help feeling jealous when she was promoted over my head.
She was so jealous of her boyfriend that she always tried to keep him to herself, never allowing him to spend time with his friends or family.
The athlete learned that envy never enriched any man, so he focused on his own training and improvement instead of being jealous of his competitors.
She was jealous, humiliated, and emotionally at the end of her tether.
There's always going to be jealous people saying you're doing this, that and the other.
words.defineEn: feeling angry and unhappy because someone else has what we want
words.defineVi: cảm thấy tức giận và không vui vì người khác có những gì chúng ta muốn

examples: He's just brilliant.
Three cheers for Sarah, whose brilliant goal at the last minute won us the game!
That was a brilliant pass by Holden.
It's a brilliant place for hearing about jobs through the grapevine.
He had a nose for trouble and a brilliant tactical mind.
words.defineEn: extremely clever, talented, or impressive
words.defineVi: cực kỳ thông minh, tài năng, hoặc ấn tượng

examples: The menu featured a creative dish of beef plate tacos.
We came up with a creative solution to the problem.
As a creative experiment, I mixed salad burnet into my homemade pesto sauce.
He used pignuts as a creative substitute for nuts in his homemade granola bars.
Mary, as the young blood of the department, is already making an impact with her creative solutions and proactive approach.
words.defineEn: making use of imagination or innovation in bringing something into existence
words.defineVi: sử dụng trí tưởng tượng hoặc sự đổi mới trong việc đưa một cái gì đó vào sự tồn tại

examples: To go crazy/mad/nuts/insane.
It’s crazy to make these changes without involving the students.
Her infectious laughter and radiant smile made him crazy.
It drives me crazy seeing all these people just staring at their phones all day long.
Would you stop shouting, you're driving me crazy!
words.defineEn: not possessing a stable and healthy mental condition
words.defineVi: không có tình trạng tinh thần ổn định và khỏe mạnh

examples: A cup of tea sounds perfect.
The combination of the meatloaf, mashed potatoes, and greens was perfect.
The orange pumpkin was perfect for Halloween.
Good afternoon, the weather is perfect for a walk.
The refreshing Muscat grape juice was the perfect choice for a hot summer day.
words.defineEn: being as great, complete, and flawless as possible
words.defineVi: tuyệt vời, đầy đủ và hoàn hảo nhất có thể

examples: His advice wasn't very helpful.
A CEO may receive helpful suggestions from the least experienced employee, as even a mouse may help a lion.
Thank you, you've been so helpful.
Morin's book is a helpful guide to surviving the first few months in harness.
His kind and helpful nature is evident in the way he treats others.
words.defineEn: willing to help someone; giving help or ready to help
words.defineVi: sẵn sàng giúp đỡ ai đó; giúp đỡ hoặc sẵn sàng giúp đỡ

examples: That contest wasn't fair!
The food was fair to middling.
Everyone should have a fair slice of the cake.
All of his teachers are going bananas over his science fair experiment.
They were fair people before it went to their heads.
words.defineEn: treating everyone equally and in a right or acceptable way
words.defineVi: đối xử bình đẳng với mọi người và theo cách đúng đắn hoặc có thể chấp nhận được

examples: They had called her rude names.
I was piqued by his rude remark.
One of my colleagues was rude to me in a meeting, and I was tempted to snap back.
He made a rude remark, but I let it ride.
Being rude to me won't get you anywhere.
words.defineEn: having no respect for other people
words.defineVi: không tôn trọng người khác

examples: Her father looked unhappy.
She left me with the impression that she was unhappy.
Elizabeth feels frustrated when people assume she's unhappy because she's on the shelf.
Believe me, the last thing I want is for you to be unhappy.
The man had everything he could ever want, but still felt unhappy and unfulfilled, realizing that a loveless life is living death.
words.defineEn: not happy; feeling sad
words.defineVi: không vui; cảm thấy buồn

examples: Both men wore confident smiles.
She felt confident and beautiful in her new swimsuit.
I'm confident that the new restaurant will go like a bomb and become a popular dining destination.
And nothing was so irritating as the confident way he used archaic idiom.
During the chess tournament, Jane was confident in her skills, but her opponent ended up cleaning her clock with a series of surprising moves.
words.defineEn: being certain about our plans, abilities, the future, etc. and believing that we can gain success
words.defineVi: chắc chắn về kế hoạch, khả năng, tương lai của mình, v.v. và tin rằng chúng ta có thể đạt được thành công

examples: The film was so scary I was shaking in my boots.
He watched a scary movie and got scared during the suspenseful scenes.
They never watch scary movies because they find them too frightening.
The car accident was scary, but thankfully no one was seriously injured - nothing so bad but might have been worse.
Moving to a new city was scary, but it was also a chance for him to spread his wings and start a new chapter in his life.
words.defineEn: making us feel fear
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy sợ hãi

examples: The active ingredient checks the growth of bacteria.
Mary gets on in years gracefully, maintaining her active lifestyle and pursuing her passions.
Even in his old age, Mr. Jenkins remains fit as a flea by taking long walks every day and maintaining an active lifestyle.
The accident left Peter with a broken leg, but thanks to a successful surgery and intensive rehabilitation, he was able to get back on his feet and resume his active lifestyle.
At a ripe old age, Mary remains active and engaged in various hobbies and interests, embracing life to the fullest.
words.defineEn: (of a person) doing many things with a lot of energy
words.defineVi: (của một người) làm nhiều việc với rất nhiều năng lượng

examples: The weather in this city is usually mild throughout the year.
Almond-leaved pear has a mild sweetness and a hint of almond taste.
I like the mild spiciness and crisp texture that green pepper adds to my omelettes.
His favorite season is spring, when the weather is mild and the flowers are in full bloom.
I'm not a fan of spicy foods, but I really enjoy the mild flavor of yellow capsicum.
words.defineEn: not much, serious, or strong
words.defineVi: không nhiều, nghiêm trọng, hoặc mạnh mẽ

examples: Last night we served individual portions of chicken and mushroom aspic.
As a health-conscious individual, he sprinkled ground flaxseed over his morning yogurt.
Then the punishment of individuals invariably took account of the harm or damage done to the victim.
They ordered individual mini meatloaves, topped with a tangy ketchup glaze.
As a health-conscious individual, he appreciated the nutritional benefits of incorporating poppy seeds into his meals.
words.defineEn: given to or related to one single person or thing
words.defineVi: trao cho hoặc liên quan đến một người duy nhất hoặc điều

examples: l'd been pound foolish.
Even the most successful businessmen have made foolish decisions at some point in their careers, proving that every man has a fool in his sleeve.
You made me look foolish in front of our friends.
It is to be feared that the Council's attitude is penny wise, pound foolish.
He is indeed penny wise and pound foolish.
words.defineEn: not thinking or behaving wisely
words.defineVi: không suy nghĩ hoặc hành xử khôn ngoan

examples: Certain species of fucoid algae serve as habitats for small marine creatures.
As with all diseases, certain groups will be more at risk than others.
The store sometimes offers discounts on certain items.
The distinct taste and texture of kelp are appreciated in certain cuisines around the world.
Certain species of dinoflagellates can create red tides, affecting marine life.
words.defineEn: feeling completely sure about something and showing that you believe it
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hoàn toàn chắc chắn về điều gì đó và thể hiện rằng bạn tin vào điều đó

examples: The library is often quiet during weekdays.
Be quiet, please.
We lead a very quiet life.
Surprisingly, the quiet neighborhood came alive with vibrant festivities during the annual festival.
You've been awfully quiet tonight, honey.
words.defineEn: (of a person) not talking too much
words.defineVi: (của một người) không nói quá nhiều

examples: The weakness of the enemy makes our strength.
She has a weakness for polite men, use that to your advantage.
They've both had knee injuries, but the two friends make light of their weaknesses.
Don't be afraid to own up to your flaws and weaknesses.
I've always had a weakness for soccer, I can't stay home when others are playing outside.
words.defineEn: lack of enough strength or power
words.defineVi: thiếu đủ sức mạnh hoặc quyền lực
